Water color; On the shore in Chiaja

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Three men move a boat lying on the shore, at left. At right are a standing and spinning woman, a seated woman nursing a baby with a girl standing beside her, three men and an eating child. At left is a rock, at right is a promontory with structure, in the background are Capri and the peninsula of Sorrento. Framing line. The signature is in the lower right corner: "Gatta f. 1828."

value: Black chalk and various water colors on paper.

Project for the Tomb of the Maréchal de Belle-Isle

label: Description
value: In this monumental scheme, the Maréchal's former wife and son (each of whom had predeceased him),  flank the standing Maréchal, dressed in classical armor. The Maréchal gestures towards his wife, who stoops to greet him at the doorway (surmounted by family crest and pair of lions) of  the family mausoleum; his son (also in classical military garb) kneels and kisses his father's left hand.  The angel of death, holding a scythe, hovers above.  Smoke emanates from censors on either side of the central group.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and black ink, point of brush and brown-black ink; gray and brown wash, red watercolor, white gouache on yellow-brown wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Possibly Prunelé, Comte Andre-Gaspard-Parfait de Bizemont, Paris [1]; 24 May 1876: Alfred Hubert (sale, Paris); 1878: E.H.R. (possibly Edouard Rodigues, sale, Paris); 8 May 1894: Juan Jorges Peoli (Lugt 2020; sale, New York, no. 473); Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum               [1] Note: Possibly from the collection of Prunelé, Comte André-Gaspard-Parfait de Bizemont, but reference in Benisovich may have been misunderstood.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
A palace atrium in rocaille architecture is obliquely shown.  An elaborate urn stands upon a pedestal in its center.  Some standing women are slightly indicated.
Reverse: A small part of an ornament in graphite.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Sarah and Eleanor Hewitt.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Erminia and Vafrino Tending the Wounded Tancred after the Battle of Argento [Tancrède secouru par Herminie et Vafrin après le combat d'Argante]

label: Description
value: A wounded soldier lying on the ground is assisted by a man wearing a turban (left) and a woman (right). The group is situated in a landscape, under a tree.  At right a horse is shown and in the foreground at left, lies a discarded shield.   A circular border is suggested implying that this composition was envisioned as a tondo.  See Curatorial Notes field.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal format. Designs in the grotesque style. An exedra forms the central motif in which a woman with a dagger, probably "Tragedy," stands between two seated women; the left one holds a bloody bearded head, the right one plays a lyre. Two satyrs crouch at the outside.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black, blue ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, gold paint, graphite on wove paper

label: Credit line

"Saltarello Romano," Dancing Peasants In The Neighborhood of Rome

label: Description
value: A dancing pair with similar poses as in plate 1 of the "Raccolta" of 1809; but the boy has his hands akimbo, and the girl the right one. The tambourin is played by a girl, standing with a boy at right. A man and a woman are seated at left; a boy leans upon the legs of his father. Mountainous landscape.

"Saltarello Romano," Dancing Peasants In The Neighborhood Of Rome

The group ends with the girl at the outermost right in the etching, in a varied pose. The donkey is shown obliquely from the rear, at left.
